titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Lee Roberts Pennington papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Loralee Sepsey

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-09-11T15:57-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches, reports, memoranda, serial issues, clippings, and other printed matter relating to communism and other political issues in the United States, subversive activities in the United States, and investigative activities of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and private organizations collected by agent Lee Roberts Pennington, who specialized in investigating radical left wing activists when employed by the FBI.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lee Roberts Pennington papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1988.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Received Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of Maryland
Served as Lieutenant in the 60th Infantry in World War I
Began working for the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI)
Served as Department Commander of the District of Columbia America Legion
Served as National Executive Commiteeman of the American Legion
Believed to be employed by the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA)
Became full-time Director of the American Legion's National Americanism Commission's counter-subversive activities in Washington, DC
The Watergate scandal; Pennington under suspicion for destroying documents due to his connection with James W. McCord

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, speeches, reports, memoranda, serial issues, clippings, pamphlets, and other printed matter relating to communism in the United States, subversive activities in the United States, the issues surrounding Watergate, the Vietnam War, and the Middle East, and investigative activities of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and private organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Statement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into five series: Biographical File, General Correspondence, Printed Matter, Speeches and Writings, and Subject File.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Federal Bureau of Investigation.
controlaccess.subject: Communism--United States.
Internal security--United States.
Subversive activities--United States.

did.unittitle: Federal Bureau of Investigation case reports,
National Right to Work News Service,
United States News and World Report,
"Annual Luncheon of the Indiana Academy of General Practice,"
Boston Conference of the National Association of Bank Auditors and Comptrollers,
Erie Chapter of the National Association of Cost Accountants,
Fourty-Fourth Annual Convention of the Oklahoma Bankers Association,
"The FBI and Its War on Crime,"
"Propaganda and the Antidote from the Viewpoint of the FBI,"
Rotary and other civic clubs of Charlottesville, Virginia,
Young Men's Christian Association (Y.M.C.A.) of Buffalo, New York,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Resolution, letter, and other printed matter relating to the American Legion. The American Legion is an organization founded following World War I in 1919 offering membership to veterans and honorably discharged members of the United States Armed Forces who served at least one day of active duty in major wars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Publications, lists, articles, and other printed matter relating to the activities of the FBI.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, publications, newsletters, and other printed matter relating to Group Research, Inc., a product of the Reuther Memorandum formed by Robert Kennedy to inform the liberal parties about the activities of the conservative parties. The Reuther Memorandum stated that the activities of America's radical right-wing conservative parties were injecting their harmful ideology too deeply into the American culture as a whole (such as the persecution of Communists by the House Un-American Activities Committee headed by Senator Joseph McCarthy during the Cold War period) and were thus gaining too much power and influence.
